Key Match Events: Brazil and Costa Rica played to a 0-0 draw in their Copa América opener.
Brazil dominated possession, controlling the ball for more than 65 of the 90 minutes and outshooting Costa Rica 19-2.
Brazil's Marquinhos had a goal ruled offside after a lengthy video review in the first half.
Lucas Paqueta's shot struck the near post in the 63rd minute.
Costa Rica's keeper Patrick Sequeira made a crucial save after Haxzel Quiros misplayed a clearance.
Post-Match Reflections: Brazil's unimpressive performance against Costa Rica offered little reason to think Brazil will turn around soon.
Brazil needs a win or draw against Paraguay on Friday to get its tournament back on track.
